citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
During the inspection a dead parakeet was found on the bottom of the cage under the hanging water dish. Review of the
facility records showed that 2 parakeets and 1 finch had also died in April. The licensee said that she had discussed the
bird deaths with the attending veterinarian during an appointment for her personal pet. The attending veterinarian stated
to the inspector that she does not remember the licensee reporting the bird deaths because the licensee has not
communicated with her about the animals at the store since her facility visit in September 2024. Not communicating
medical problems, including deaths in the colony with the attending veterinarian can lead to delays in assessment and
treatment of individual animals and undetected colony health concerns. A mechanism of direct and frequent
communication is required so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being
is conveyed to the attending veterinarian. To be corrected by 7/20/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
